main event: Five adult citizens observed an unidentified flying object near East Tawas, Michigan, on March 30, 1957 at approximately 2130 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as being approximately 60 ft. in diameter and round in shape, emitting an intense blue-white light.
The object moved slowly at first, then accelerated to tremendous speed and altitude.
There was only a brief period of intelligible radar contact before the object vanished from view.
The object was observed for approximately two or three minutes.
No explanation has been found for this occurrence from conventional intelligence sources, so it must be listed as an unidentified flying object.
sighted object: a round, 60 ft. diameter object emitting an intense blue-white light
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
